Package org.dyn4j.dynamics.contact

Sub package of the Dynamics package handling contacts.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ContactListener
    Represents an object that is notified of contact events.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Contact
    Represents a contact point between two Body objects.
    ContactAdapter
    Convenience class for implementing the ContactListener interface.
    ContactConstraint
    Represents a Contact constraint for each Body pair.
    ContactConstraintId
    Represents and id for a contact constraint between two Convex Shapes on two Bodys.
    ContactConstraintSolver
    Represents an impulse based rigid Body physics collision resolver.
    ContactEdge
    Represents a contact edge connecting two bodies.
    ContactManager
    Maintains ContactConstraints between Bodys.
    ContactPoint
    Represents a contact point and used to report events via the ContactListener.
    ContactPointId
    Represents a contact point id to identify contacts from frame to frame.
    PersistedContactPoint
    Represents a persisted contact point.
    SolvedContactPoint
    Represents a solved contact point.
    TimeOfImpactSolver
    Represents a position solver for a pair of Bodys who came in contact during a time step but where not detected by the discrete collision detectors.

Package org.dyn4j.dynamics.contact Description

Sub package of the Dynamics package handling contacts.

Contacts are solved using an iterative constraint based approach.

The World object will determine all collisions between the Bodys and will turn each Manifold into a ContactConstraint. Once all the ContactConstraints have been gathered the World object will perform a depth first search on the ContactConstraint graph to yield Islands. The Islands will use the ContactManager to warm start the ContactConstraints and then use the ContactConstraintSolver to solve them.

The ContactListener can be used to receive notifications of sensed, begin, end, persisted, and pre/post solve events.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
3.1.1
Author:
William Bittle
